meanings.definition: The quality of being reliable or trustworthy.
meanings.sent1: Her dependability at work made her a valuable team member.
meanings.sent2: Customers appreciate the dependability of this brand's products.
meanings.sent3: The robot's dependability in delivering coffee caused laughter among the office staff.
meanings.sent4: His dependability was like a sturdy bridge in the storm of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The dependability of the old lighthouse guided ships safely through the night.

meanings.definition: The ability to be counted on or relied upon.
meanings.sent1: The success of the project depended on the dependability of each team member.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, the community values the dependability of its leaders.
meanings.sent3: The dependability of the weather forecast was questioned when it suddenly started snowing in summer.
meanings.sent4: Her dependability shone like a beacon of hope in the darkest of times.
meanings.sent5: The dependability of the old car surprised everyone as it started without fail every morning.
